dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Put Humpty Dumpty back together again.

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: April?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: She's with me.... (quieter) * I met this new chick. Jessie.

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: You gonna marry her and have kids?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I think so. But she dunno what I do. * I don't wanna tell her. I don't know what to do. * (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: Anyone know...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (laughs) Other than Barry and the two, three fences I got business with? No one. I'm the phantom cat. They don't have a * clue who's puttin' down my scores. (beat) I got two, three years 'til I can * split. * (an impossibility:) * What do I do? Bullshit her along?

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: Lie to no one. Someone's close to you? You'll ruin it with a lie. And if they're a stranger, then who the hell are they that you gotta lie to?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (quietly) What did you want?

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: (whispers) Get me outta here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (low) Eighteen months and you hit the street.

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, you know Dr. Shelton? *

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That lu-lu bastard's killed more guys than the electric chair.

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: (whispers) I got angina something something. I ain't gonna last no year and a half. pause) I don't want to die in here, Frank! Not in here. (CONTINUED )

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (whispers) You got it.

dialogues.speaker: OKLA
dialogues.text: Got to go, kid... Okla smiles wryly and winks and Frank leaves. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters the flashy black glossy interior with a bank bag of change. He owns the place. A couple regulars are on stools. Jukebox.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Say, Frank. Barry's been calling you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: From where!

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Three times he called. 532-4234.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: INT. COFFEE SHOP FOYER - PAY PHONE - BARRY â- DAY 69 holds down the cradle and pretends to talk to keep the line clear for Frank's call.  69 23.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Outside -- through the windows -- are apartment build- ings, heavy traffic and flashing lights from emergency vehicles. The PHONE RINGS. Barry releases the cradle.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Hell Â» (into phone) ello?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (into phone) Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: (into phone) .Â».. the hell you been?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You make the pickup?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I'm in a goddamn phone booth. Try finding one that works in this city. I have not made the pickup. We got a problem. Can you talk?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No. You see our '... man'?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: There is no 'man.' He's splattered all over the fucking sidewalk. What do you want to do? Barry's referring to the emergency vehicle lights flash- ing OUT OF FOCUS outside, down the block. Norland Ambulan pulls away with SIREN. Another squad car arrives.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He down the merch?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I was talking to somebody's somebody. I will know in 25 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (beat) Get the work car and meet me at Armitage and Lincoln. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Barry drives.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Gags was putting juice loans on the street. Right? For this lice, Attaglia. Gags was pocketing the principal and putting it back onna street for himself -- they went crazy... ba-boom! Barry pulls in and parks in front of L&A Plating on Ogden Avenue. A brown grim building among warehouses and small shelters under a forest of water towers on roofs:

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Gags down our merch?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: At the R.D. Lounge Pauli saw it go down. It was your money that was in Gags' pocket when he went out the window. Frank pulls a .45 Colt Commander from the passenger door, checks there's a shell in the chamber and holsters it in his waistband. Barry waits in the car. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enters. RECEPTIONIST behind glass. The inner offices are like a vault.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (PA filter) Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I would like to see Mr. Attaglia. You've delivered some zinc plating I had a lotta problems with. Receptionist calls somebody else. After a moment of animated conversation which we can't hear, a man named Carl looks Frank over and nods.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (PA filter) I'll buzz you in. cur TO:  72 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank enters. VINCENT ATTAGLIA is a large business- man in his late 40's. Frank crosses all the way to the right of Attaglia's desk so his position covers both Attaglia and the door.

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: I'm Mr. Attaglia. You didn't get a delivery or something? Sit down. Zinc what?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: My name's Frank. (sits) That was bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This is Joe Gags. $183,300 of my money. We have this problem...

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (reasonable) He moved my merchandise. So the money in his pocket before he went out the window is my money... I want my money.

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: I don't know what you're talking about, Mr. Frank a-la-la. Whatever. The guy died?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: So it goes to probate? Take it up in probate court! Don't bug me with this shit...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (beat) I come to discuss a piece of business. And what are you gonna do? You gonna tell me fairy tales?  3/29/80 72 73 74 26.

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are you, Slick? I don't know you. I don't know some clown named 'Gags'! Get the fuck out of here! Beat it! (shouts to outside, stands, gets up; reaches for drawer) Hey, Carl!!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 73
dialogues.text: simultaneously slams Attaglia's face with the heel of his left hand, drawing the .45 with the right, as he steps back into a Weaver stance three feet from Attaglia's face. Cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Carl. Frank drops the Weaver, the .45 to the side, strong-arms Attaglia into the line of fire, snaps the .45 back into his face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (shouts) Hold it!!

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: All right! All right! All right! Do what he tells you!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: On the floor! Spread your legs! Hands over your head! Now! They do it. They're immobilized. Attaglia's scared shitless. One guard, Carl, watches Frank. The .45's two feet from Attaglia's face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Carl) Look at the wall! He does.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing; to Attaglia) I'm the last guy you wanna fuck with. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You found my money on Gags! Let's pretend you don't know whose money it is!

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: (scared to death) That's right for Chrissake! I mean I don't know who you are! I'll straighten you up! I will!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Three hours. I will call to set a meet. You will pay me my money. $183,300. Frank's eyes scan the three men as he backs to the door and simply leaves. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: under a bridge. A towering industrial landscape. PULL BACK TO REVEAL the other men: LEO ALDERMAN and MITCH KANOFF listen. Leo is a large blocky man. Mitch is even heavier. Leo is a kidder. He has good humor. Charm. He's a nice man. He'd kill you as soon as look at you. He wears a black cashmere top- coat over a plaid shirt. Among the cars in the b.g. is Leo's black BMW 733i.

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: He 'downed merch to Gags' is what he said. I'm telling you this cocksucker's trouble. We whack him out...

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (to Mitch; dismissing Attaglia) This the prowler? This the guy Gags had?

dialogues.speaker: MITCH
dialogues.text: Has to be the one.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: bounces over ruts and bumps TO CAMERA while they're talking about him.  76 77 78
76 Men spread out, relaxed. Frank gets out, crosses over ... keeping some distance.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: My name is Leo Alderman. How are you? They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm Frank.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Here's your money.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: counts it and pockets the $183,300.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: All there?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It's there.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (wry) Don't you say 'thanks' or something?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (smiles) Whose money was this?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Your money. (beat) But I kept this guy from giving you a hard time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and the H & K .308 assault rifle he has sighted on Leo, Attaglia, etc... Frank's back-up.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (knowing smile) Mm-hum. 'Thanks.'

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You're welcome... it's no big deal. 77 78  78 79

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: See ya.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Where you goin'?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'm already late...

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon. I thought we'd talk business. Get to know each other.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nothing personal but I want to know people, I'll join a fucking country club...

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (laughs) But I know you already. No reaction.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah? (beat) How do you know me?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: The merch you put to Gags and Max Sherman and that Puerto Rican fence, Cotazar? Where do you think they down it? To me. I'm the bank. I handle the fence for half this city. You're putting down two, three scores a month. Month in, month out. And I see your stuff. You got great taste. A regular highline pro. I told Gags, 'I want to meet this guy!' He tell you that?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Fine.  79

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Let's cut the bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (beat; then) You want to go to work for me? Directly? You'll put down contact scores all over the country.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: ... I'm self-employed, I'm doin' fine. I don't deal with egos. I'm Joe the boss. What the fuck do I need to go to work for you for?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I'll lay it out. You be the judge.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You don't look, you don't case, you don't do nothing no more. We point you to a score, we tell you what's in there. When we tell you it's there, it's there. They are laid-out scores.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How they worked up?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Alarm system diagrams. Blueprints. Sometimes the front door key. Sometimes the scores are in on it, everybody's ripping off the insurance company.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Work cars, drops, tools?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Whatever you need, you'd see me. I would be your father. Money, guns, cars. I'd be your father from here on out.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What's my end?  79

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You get a price. There is no negotiation about the price. We got expenses here you don't have. You'll know the price up front.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How big?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Boxcar. Nothing under middle six figures. You'll make a million dollars in four months.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I go to work for you, I'm pulling all this exposure.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Our protection trades that off.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I take a bust...?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Turn around: there'll be a bondsman and a lawyer there. You'll never spend a night in jail.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Uh-huh... (beat) I steal ice. No furs, no coin collections, no treasury bonds, no cartage, no stock certificates, no precious metals. No nothing. Just diamonds. Or cash.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I work with a partner.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: We take care of you. A partner is your responsibility. He beefs on you, that's your problem. He beefs on us, that's your problem, too. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: LEO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He is never supposed to know anything about us. Never bring him around. He never meets me.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Who are your inside people?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: That's my end. It's nothing to do with you. So what do you say, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I dunno.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Whaddya mean, âyou dunno'? C'mon with me!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I dunno! I don't believe in lifetime subscriptions. Maybe this don't fit with my retirement program.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do retired?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Pick corn with the chickens and watch daytime TV for the rest of my life. What's the difference?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (cracks up; he likes Frank) All right! Two, three moves? You wanna keep goin'? Fine. You wanna split? Everybody's businesslike; everybody's an adult. That's fine, too. (beat) So let me know. 'Cause you'd be terrific.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'll call you. They shake hands and all start to leave.  80 81 82 83 84 33.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 80
dialogues.text: gets in the Eldorado and drives away.

dialogues.speaker: BOREKSCO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: URIZZI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How the hell do I know?! PULL WAY BACK TO REVEAL a police observation post a half-mile away on a bridge tumbril and two beefy Chicago cops behind a Nikon with a 500mm lens on a tripod. URIZZI -- the senior man at 40 -- leans back and eats a corned beef sandwich and drinks beer. Boreksco looks through the camera. An unmarked car is parked at the bridge. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: blasts through the Gold Coast: NOISE. Rush Street, State Street, Dearborn. He drives fast, erratic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: gets in the Eldo alone and whips out. No Jessie. Frank's looking. FOLLOW it UP the glare of Clark Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: up Clark to Broadway. The hookers and pimps and bums and flash tourists: city dogs and glitter. It all reflects off Frank. A lot of NOISE...Frank BLASTS his HORN and whips around a slow driver. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: thru window - Frank's car pulls down Lincoln, U-turns and parks. Two drunks argue in a doorway. HOLD. Mighty Joe Young belts out "Turning Point In My Life" -- hard-driving Chicago blues. Frank presses through the standing crowd, drinks in hand. TIGHTEN: he finds Jessie at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Finding you...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Forget it. Okay?! You're two hours late. I mean, I don't need this! I don't need a let- down. He takes her arm. She rips it away.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Fuck you!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I want to talk to you!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: No! Frank grabs her arm. Twenty people are watching them fight.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'll take you for coffee and explain...!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Take your goddam hand off me!!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to Jessie) Watch out!

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (large bartender) Hey, you!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: You take me anywhere? Forget it. Frank strong-arms Jessie.

dialogues.speaker: HARRY
dialogues.text: (with a sap at his side) I'm talking to you!!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Maybe there is a reason! (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ya ever think of that? What is this big goddamn deal! (to bartender) Take a walk, Flash... He does. Jessie struggles.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I don't know the reason. I don't wanna hear the reason! There is no 'reason'! It just showed me! That's all!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You were looking forward to this!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (rips away) Big mistake!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ! Frank drags her out onto the sidewalk by her arm. A half dozen people spectate the fight.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Get in the car! Don't make a scene!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (mad) Get in the goddamn car! He grabs Jessie by the arm and throws her into the car. He moves around to his side. She gets out...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 86
dialogues.text: catches her, shoves aside a citizen who tries to in- terfere, drags her around to his side and throws her in his side where he can keep one arm on her and then drives away. cur TO:  4/1/80 36.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 87
dialogues.text: City at night -- taillights on wet, black streets, steel-girder bridges, science-fiction high-rise com- plexes -- pass by. All dark. Then for the Adlai Stevenson Expressway.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: In what I do there are sometimes pressures. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) What the hell do you think I do? Jessie doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Come on, come on, come on! For five months you and I been saying "hi' every morning I walk in for breakfast. What do you think I do?!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: A brain surgeon. You sell cars!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I wear 150-dollar slacks, silk shirts and 800-dollar suits, a gold watch and a perfect D-flawless, three-karat ring... (pause) ...I change cars like other guys change their shoes. Jessie looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hey, baby: I ama thief. I been in prison.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Congratulations. Why tell me?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: âCause I didn't tell my wife. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who is now gone. I ever come on to you? Huh? No. See? See what?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: See I am a straight. I ama true-blue kinda guy! I been cool. Now I'm unmarried. So we can cut the mini-moves and bullshit and have a big romance.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (shrieks) You are out of your goddamn mind! You think I'm come along?! off with your (blase) You think I'm waiting for you to Where do you come shit?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: kidding. I can tell. This is strictly on the up and up...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (exasperated) Jesus Christ...! Jessie looks out the window in total exasperation. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: TO BOOTH
dialogues.text: You're scared

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: to death.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: You are an asshole! People turn and look. That's lovely. my face!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don't come up into (MORE)
88 FRANK (cont'd) (beat) What are you doing in your life that is so terrific?!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: I am fine!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: You don't know about me! Where I've been. Where I'm coming from?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don't shout in here! I know all about you. Inside.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Bullshit you do!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: So then tell me. People in next booth move to another table.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (beat; then) I have put my act together after eight years of a very bad situation. End of story.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (to waitress) Gimme some more coffee here. (to Jessie) Sorry... So?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: So nothing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What was it like?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Lifestyling. Lot of money. Tucson. Then Mexico City. Culiacan. Bogota. Drifting. Okay?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Lifestyling got twisted and then empty. It was actually over. But we kept moving through the moves. Then it ended badly. Now I get up in the morning, I take a shower, I go to my job. I have a social security card. My life is very ordinary which is good. And very solid.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You are marking time is what you are. You are backing off, hiding out. You are waiting for a bus that's late and hoping it never shows so you won't have to get on and go somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: You have a license for this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How much was he moving?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (surprised he knew) Nothing. Till towards the end. Then kilo amounts. I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: He's dead.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He... was an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: There was love and expectations for living a life in the beginning...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He was an asshole for putting you in a box. (mad, shouts) You know what'd happen to you day and night if you had to do a bit in Columbia?! Jesus Christ!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (smiles) Don't shout in here! (beat) I was left alone with no money, no clothes, no visa standing on the corner in Bogota, Columbia. "Things" ... did happen. (beat) Where were you in prison? Pass the cream. Waitress passes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Joliet. Cream's spoiled ... (to waitress) ... some new cream here. (to Jessie) The warden was Joe Reagan.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: What's wrong with this?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: "What's wrong with this?" It's cottage cheese. (to Jessie) Joe Reagan. Meatball Joe. If he's a penologist, I'm a jet airplane pilot. (beat) I did 11 years. I got out four years ago. New cream arrives. Jessie stares at him in disbelief. Then:

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: What did you go up for?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I stole 40 dollars.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It started with a two-year bit, a parole in six months. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right away I got into a 'problem' with two guys, tried to turn me out. Picked up nine more years on the manslaughter beef. Other things. I was 20 when I went in. 31 by the time I got out. Anyway Â«=Â». you don't count months and years. You don't do time that way.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Why?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: âWhy'? You gotta not give a fuck if you live or die. Forget time. You gotta get to nothing means nothing. When you achieve that attitude, you can survive. (pause) I'll tell you a story. All about everything you gotta know about me. (pause) Once there was this Captain Morphis: 300-pound slob who couldn't write his name. He had this crew of 16 or 17 guards and cons. Prison group. Crews. They'd go into cells, grab young guys, up to hydrotherapy in the mental wing. Gang bang. Guy puts up a struggle? Beat him half to death. Ends up in the funny farm. (beat) Word comes down it's my turn tonight. (beat) And I know I am going the route... (snap) ... like that. 'Cause nothing means nothing anyway, including myself. If I can get hit on whenever some other guy decides. So fuck it, man. Fuck me. I am dead. (he drinks his coffee) 11:30 or 12:00, lights come on. dialogues.text: (pushes back chair) This is not a marketplace! My God! Jessie is trying to pull Frank away.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You are not smart enough to take it any more than you can spot good parents!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KNOWLES
dialogues.text: Get out of my office. Jessie sees a Security Guard across the outer office noticing the noise.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You didn't ask about us?! What kind of people we are! There's some kid waiting. And you're denying him us and us him?! Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (re guard) Frank! Don't make a scene!

dialogues.speaker: MRS. KNOWLES
dialogues.text: Our criteria...!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Your criteria are so far up your ass, they can't see daylight! (beat) This is bullshit!

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: yells at Frank) Cut it out! Wake up! It's not happening!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (beserk to Mrs. Knowles) I got ABC-type information for you. I was state-raised. This is a dead place! A child in eight-by-four green walls! After awhile, you tell the walls: âMy Life is yours!! Where'd you grow up? Inna suburbs? Frank slams out pushing aside the guard. Jessie follows. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: asleep in front of the house on the landing. We don't know why. A coffee cup is next to her. NOTHING. HOLD. Then Frank's Eldo rounds the corner and approaches.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Jessie! Jessie rouses. WIDEN TO INCLUDE Frank with his duffle bag. His hand goes inside... Jessie puts a finger to her lips and mouth: "Don't talk!" cur TO:  133 134 135 136 137 138 139 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: enter. The counters and floor are marbled but unfin- ished. A gaping hole is where the dishwasher will go. Josie leads Frank to the table and a note: "Look at phone!"

dialogues.speaker: UNDER SINK
dialogues.text: Frank pulls a tool kit and extracts a screwdriver.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: carefully removes the plastic cover. It's bugged.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: writes "What he say?" Josie shakes her head: "Nothing."

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You all right...?

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: Yes. What does it mean?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Heat. Police. (beat) It means it's hard for me to make moves from now on... beepers on the cars, the works.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Probably only the phones. I'1l check. You uneasy? Fuck this house. We'll move! 133 134 135 136 137 138 139  139 140 141 142 143 66.

dialogues.text: in front of a sandwich-like fragment of wall held ina vise. Sam constructed the fragment to duplicate the vault.

dialogues.text: and NOISE smash into the vault section.

dialogues.text: kills the gas.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 151

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: $210,000 expenses. You want me to put some to work for you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (cynical) Onna street? Juice?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: What? Juice? You couldn't get me out of bed for that. We're not cutting up nickles there. Shopping centers. Jackson, Fort Worth, Davenport. Strickly legit.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: My money goes in my pocket. Bartender brings him a coke.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: ... Yours if you want in. I'm gonna give you everything you need, kid. Don't tell me now. Let me know later.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah well, something I want to know, now. (hot; slow) Why the hell as soon's I get involved with you everyone knows my business? I got the house bugged. My wife's upset. The Vehicle Bureau guy wants a fur coat. A cop tail's a half block down the street. My car's bugged. This one behind the bumper I'm supposed to find. (slams bug down) A second one they got in the wheel well's supposed to fool me. What is this?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (alarmed) ... when you downed the stones...?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I used the work car. I only let them tail the Eldo. But they'll get hip to that trick.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Leave it to me. What about the burning bar?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: "Leave it to you"... just do it!

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: I said: I'll take care of it! Will the bar cut it?!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Okay! (relaxes) ... Â£ifth alarm system.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Nothing yet.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: What else you got on your mind?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You got family problems? Something with the old lady?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What is this? Fucking Dear Abby?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (pause) You trying to adopt a kid?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (long pause) How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Barry mentioned to Mitch... Mitch to me... You got friends! Lighten up for chrissake! (beat) Whyn't you come to me with your problem? What am I? A fucking stranger? I take care of my people.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You and me do 'business.' I don't mix apples and oranges.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Ah bullshit! With my wife, my kids, I am very tight. (beat) Kids are special. A miracle. A little hoochie-koo! A drop of energy and Wham Bam, Magic Sam. Something sacred's there. (beat) Now that's my attitude!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (pause; thinks; then) What happens?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: You state your model: black, brown, yellow or white! Boy or girl.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Where from?

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Couple of ladies... they got babies ... to sell. Their own. And they sell âem. Frank looks at Leo. Leo looks at Frank directly.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... it's not the baby's fault his mother's an asshole. And you are not buyin' the mother. And you are not gonna get a kid onna straight...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (simply) I want a boy.

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Done. You got a boy. See that? Frank throws an arm around Leo's neck and grabs his leg.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (kidding) You sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Mitch! Get him off me! Leo's benign, paternalistic. Mitch laughs. Frank's gone to the phone.

dialogues.text: (into phone) Jessie? cur TO:  3/29/80 73. 153

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well...? They look at the baby. This is their child.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) Here we are... Frank doesn't know what to say. Holding their baby. Jessie touches his thigh. It's a very special connec- tion: his woman and his child.

dialogues.text: (continuing) +. long, long time. See that? Okla dies, our kid is born...

dialogues.text: (to Frank) ...Stand-up guy. You're a stand- up guy...you got a mouth...you can take a trimming.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: BARCELL
dialogues.text: You could make everything easy for everybody. But, no, you gotta be a goof. You are real good. No violence. Strictly professional. I probably like you personally. Go to the track, ball games, stuff like that? What's the diff? You know? There's ways of doing things that round off the corners and make life easy for everybody. What's wrong with that? There's plenty to go around. We know what you take down. We know you got something major coming up soon. (beat) But you gotta come on like a stiff prick! Who the fuck do you think you are? What's wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: URIZZI
dialogues.text: Nick Pollo and Frank Sadler started making waves. After? They called us the Hefty garbage bag brigade... Big joke. Frank's still hurt.

dialogues.speaker: BARCELL

dialogues.text: It ever...occur to you...to work for a living...put down your own scores?...

dialogues.text: (nods; finality; leaving) ...Okay. This guy's a goof. Screw him. 83. 203 (CONTINUED )

The fridge door swings back open, lighting the crumbled body of Attaglia, spilled milk and Frank: moving to clear the den off the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo's 50-year-old zombie wife in her housecoat and run- down slippers, watches t.v. on the formica and chrome kitchen table and turns as Frank enters, the .45 coming. She reacts to it, not at all. She turns back to the t.v.

dialogues.speaker: LEO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (from living room, annoyed) Vince? Christ! What did you break?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: moves to clear the dining room.  3/30/80 334 335 336 337 338 339 340

dialogues.speaker: LEO
dialogues.text: Vincent? Vince! Nothing. He pulls a gun, hits the lights and starts toward the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: entering, moving. Dining room is west of foyer. Frank opens shadowed corners, the .45 snaps to the fire position, then down to orange. He breathes heavily, as he moves to the west corner - the most threatening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: inches out from behind the arch - east of the dining room - and sees Frank's gun up to the west. Leo darts back, trapped, in the living room by Frank's method.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: works the east corner of the dining room and moves into the foyer. He works the space entering corners obliquely and clearing walls at his rear. INTERCUT HIS POV. At each dead area, the .45 snaps up into firing position. Then down to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: caught, moves into the corner behind the sofa, near a lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: seen obliquely working the room with the .45 from the foyer. He sees corners, dead spaces, shadows. Finally, there's only the corner where Leo is.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 341
dialogues.text: Moves through the arch, the .45 comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leo FIRES a wild SHOT. Frank FIRES TWICE blowing Leo against the lamp which doesn't break. Leo raises the Magnum again. Frank's third SHOT kills him. Leo's position is bent and grotesque; the fallen lamp is lurid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: meanwhile struggles with side screen door and finally smashes it off the top hinge, falls out and stumbles across the side lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: are running as Frank enters from the side of the house. the Guard is hauling a carbine. Carl is bring up his shotgun as...

dialogues.speaker: ATTAGLIA
dialogues.text: across the street, running away, almost to the curb, spins and FIRES wildly TWICE. Misses. While...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 346
dialogues.text: FIRES from a Weaver combat stance hitting Carl who's knocked back. Frank speed reloads, FIRES ONE SHOT, downing the Guard, Carl is bringing up the shotgun. Frank HAMMERS ON TWO SHOTS into Attaglia as he's panning back Carl's shotgun FIRES. Frank is knocked back, his shirt shredded, he aims coolly, FIRES TWICE. Carl's dead.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 347
dialogues.text: walks away from the sidewalk. The shredded shirt reveals the black vest. The heavy .45 with the hammer still back, hangs at the end of his arm. His face bleeds where two of the shots hit him.  348 349 350 351 352 353 354 118.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK 348
dialogues.text: down the sidewalk towards the Eldo down the street. Neighbors in housecoats and robes runs past to see what happened. Most ignore him. One or two see the blood and the gun and back off. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: DAY 349
dialogues.text: It's summer. It's sun-baked. The sidewalks are pink and hot. Smoked glass and steel buildings. Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: approaches, searches, stops. Jessie's driving.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE 351
dialogues.text: gets out. She looks different. Time's passed. She checks an address. Goes in. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: DAY 352
dialogues.text: White walls. Light carpets. Minimal. Cell-like. A man in a T-shirt drinks coffee in REAR SHOT over glass and steel table. Beyond him is a wall of light and sky: floor to ceiling window. A DOORBELL RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: HIS HAND 353
dialogues.text: puts down the coffee mug. FOLLOW his hand to the door. A black .45 is holstered in the small of his back.

dialogues.speaker: DOOR 354
dialogues.text: opens. Jessie stands there. Hallway recedes behind her.  119.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: is Frank. He is truly astonished. New scars have healed on his face from the shotgun wound. Jessie walks past him to stand against the light. He closes the door. He crosses to her. He doesn't touch her. We don't know if she's bitter.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (soft) What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: Finding you.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: How'd you get here?

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: By looking for five months. Frank looks away.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Why? Jessie looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (continuing) I have never expected you would find me. I did not expect you would look.

dialogues.speaker: JESSIE
dialogues.text: (beat) Your children are at the motel, Frank. He touches her... FREEZE. RUN END CREDITS.
